channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.

item.title: Justice Department releases more Epstein files. Some of them mention Trump
item.description: The Justice Department released a new batch of files Tuesday related to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein that contained hundreds of references to President Trump.
item.content:encoded: The Justice Department released a new batch of files Tuesday related to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein that contained hundreds of references to President Trump.

item.title: Rep. Ro Khanna, D-Calif., on lawmakers demanding more Epstein files be released
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel asks Democratic Congressman Ro Khanna of California about lawmakers' demands that the Justice Department release more files related to Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: Crime in the U.S. fell in 2025. Will the trend continue?
item.description: Crime rates dropped across much of the U.S. in 2025. That was true for both property and violent crime. And it declined nearly everywhere: In big cities and small towns, and in red and blue states.

item.title: Trump administration wants to set quota for denaturalizing American citizens
item.description: The Trump administration says it wants to establish a quota for next year to denaturalize up to 200 American citizens per month.

item.description: A much-delayed report shows the U.S. economy grew a robust 4.3% between July and September, fueled by consumer spending.

item.title: SCOTUS rules Trump can't send National Guard to Chicago without governor's permission
item.description: The Supreme Court ruled against President Trump on Tuesday, refusing to reinstate, for now, President Trump's ability to send National Guard troops into Illinois over the objections of its governor.
